Posts.EditableText: Hello I am starting work on my text adventure game and I am at the point where I want my player to pick their race and have stats already ready for them. I know that I need to modify the player attribute tab but for the life of me I can't seem to find it anywhere on the desktop version. Could someone point me in the right direction?

Posts.EditableText: Never mind I figured it out. Turns out that it was because I was using the Gamebook template.

Posts.EditableText:
there's NO GUI/Editor 'Attribute' Tab in/for the Game Book quest version, as it's mainly meant for creating CYOA games (with not that much fancy coding/rpg-features), you have to use scripting (Page Type: [SCRIPT] or [SCRIPT+TEXT] -> add new attribute), or work with the code directly.

the Text Adventure quest version, is the full capability of quest software, so it's got everything that is the quest software (extensive GUI/Editor controls/options and etc stuff)

(also, some people start with the 'simple mode', but then they go try to do the normal stuff, not realizing that the simple mode doesn't have the normal stuff, as it's meant to be a very simple sandbox to get used to using quest, and so don't realize they need to turn/tick/check off the simple mode, or make a new game, not in simple mode)

----------

here's some starter links/guides for you:

http://textadventures.co.uk/forum/general/topic/ljjm32av4e2t9ot49k478g/help#710be61e-eae1-4af1-8363-520cc718ba1c

ask if you need help with anything
